comments.body: Maybe on a feature showcase on minecraft.net, but I don't see why it should be on the launcher
Splat Ty, he's saying to be able to see your own screenshots, which are typically saved locally. The website couldn't possibly bring up your screenshots without you uploading them manually.
Идея крутая, также будет прикольно, если можно будет их выгружать прямо из лаунчера
This would be great, and make it easier to look at screenshots.
so how do we make a screenshot on pe (beta)
This will also add better support for m1 macs.

See, I was always wanting this feature. I had to manually patch this for my ARM system (to be fair, I haven't tried this with the Raspberry Pi 4, but I think it actually has enough resources to run this). It's less of a concern for me since the original system in question died, but with the Pi 4 and everything in general being ARM these days it'd be nice to have official support (and I may try that again). AFAIK it's basically just providing a couple extra libraries that already have those versions so it's aggravating that it has taken this long.

Although, the new launcher, ironically not being Java based, might complicate matters now.

I just bought minecraft, only to find out that I can't sign in to the launcher on the Raspberry pi 4. Since the only launcher available is the Java-based legacy launcher, it doesn't recognize Microsoft accounts. Adding ARM32 compatibility to the newer launcher is basically essential because of the account migration.

(Plz Plz Plz listen to us)

Mind, I'd love it if the launcher could transition BACK to being cross-platform and Java-based for the Java Edition. I don't have Bedrock, but I imagine that has a different launcher anyway, so why not use Java for the Java Edition's launcher?

There are probably 3rd party launchers available, but to my knowledge those don't support the MS account and I suspect there are fees and security reviews to do that (probably going to need to pay for 3rd party launchers now... they just got even more sketchy) because suddenly the login is now used across your entire computer ecosystem rather than for a harmless game with its own login.

A further complaint is that the new launcher still has ads and options for all the new Minecraft-themed stuff like Dungeons, but I can't actually run those on Linux in the first place. So there is no reason for an integrated launcher. Why not skip the integration for stuff (that promptly says you can't use it) and not bother maintaining all the compile flags in the Windows launcher to bring back a "for everyone else" Java launcher? That was what it was for in the first place!

Please, either keep maintaining some variant of the Java launcher or drop the push toward the MS account logins. I'm not going to be changing my username regardless, so why not use gamertags for if someone happens to claim mine in the future if you want to go for name reuse, and just handle usernames without a hashtag on the end (my own, since it's original) like you always have?
It would be EXTREMELY hard to run Minecraft on any ARM32 computer but I’m all for ARM64.
I’ve ran Minecraft with the old launcher and it runs fine on the Pi 4.

The 'old launcher' is the legacy launcher, which uses java and should be able to run on anything as long as you have java installed.  HOWEVER, unless you have a legacy account, it will stop working once they finish migrating accounts. For example, I have a mojang account, and my only computer at this point is a raspberry pi.  When the legacy launcher is dropped*, I won't be able to login to the game unless I use a modded launcher, such as ATlauncher, which if I recall correctly, is not legal and can result in account deletion. (not sure if the rules have been changed since I last read them). So this means that adding ARM support is my only option, aside from buying a new computer. 

 

*the support for mojang accounts will end, but if you use a legacy account (login with username and password, no email) it will still work until they figure out how to migrate those as well.

I was 'upgraded', which means that I now have to log in using my hotmale credentials instead of my mojang credentials. Pretty pointless tbh, all that has been achieved is that I can no longer play using my pi4 because the arm launcher only does mojang credentials. 

When is this going to be fixed?

^ Pretty much exactly what happened to me. I too got the upgrade notice (again, if the previous system was designed or used properly we wouldn't have needed this security nightmare. MS wants a new MS account per MC login; why not have a selector if they're doing a new process? I didn't even know it was in the TOS that I could have multiple MS accounts and there's a lot more personal information too. Now I can get hacked AND doxxed!) and felt forced to do it since I don't want to lose access to the game and they're just going to make us upgrade sooner or later.

I wasn't using this on the Pi *yet*, but I just got one and it would have been nice to have the option.
I've found that ATLauncher has a microsoft login option, but I'm not sure wheter using alternate launchers is allowed ever.
3rd day of me trying to figure out how to play minecraft on pi4. nothing si far :((
Mojang add it to much arm64 users are waiting for this (including me).
How do i open it?

I know this is already a couple of years. I am with a Surface Pro 9 5G/ARM and I was wondering is there is already a launcher - I am with the Bedrock AND the Java Edition; I want to use both. However, on the Mac, Linux, Windows x86, everything is good (Linux / Mac of course Java) but not on ARM. Is there a plan for the Java edition?

I really want to play Bedrock edition for the live event, but I can't because of the Minecraft Launcher's incompatibility with ARM64 Linux. Also, why is Bedrock edition only for Windows? This is very annoying, please fix it!

I'd like to briefly mention that Mojang really has no choice here as of WWDC25. Apple WILL remove support for Rosetta 2 after macOS 27, so they need to make the Minecraft Launcher Apple Silicon native rather soon. I doubt it'd be hard either given even Steam could do it within a few days of the removal announcement going public, and that the Launcher is nothing but a glorified web app in all aspects.

My account got ratted. A phishing attack from a Discord/Hypixel look alike. I have 2FA enabled, didn't prevent this. They can login using the access token, and all valuables on the account is gone. Please add a button to invalidate all active sessions and tokens. Effectively requiring relogin (with 2FA if enabled), so control can be reclaimed. Currently the rogue can login as pleased. Very discomforting.

Please, add a way to hide snapshots scrolling through them is just a pain.

I don't want to scroll through hundreds of snapshot versions just to find the one version I want to play - they should be toggleable.
that checkbox is intended for the list of installations, not the version list in "Create new installation". However it definitely still needs an option to hide snapshots in the version list.

I completely agree.  The new launcher also signs you into Microsoft Office applications which I DO NOT WANT!

This!
It's super clumsy at the moment.
You have to log out 1st account, log in with 2nd account through the popup-xbox-weirdness - often fetching one time code from your mailbox to do so, and then again if you want to switch back.
And the launcher remembers only the current account.
And in every turn you need to tell your windows in the background to take it easy even if the user changes. :(

In the previous launcher I had a simple drop down menu where I just select the account I want to use. And I had to rarely do full login process, because it remembered my accounts and logins.

Many players have "camera accounts" (Me included), There are siblings and families that play on the same computer.

Something easier and more straight forward is absolutely needed.

I would be happy to use the new launcher if I could log on to both of my accounts. Like the same system as the old launcher made it easy to switch accounts with one click instead of having to login every time.

I have multiple migrated accounts I frequently switch between, and it is tedious to do so in the new launcher.  I feel as though this is not an edge case, and many people (including content creators that provide a lot of value to Minecraft) will have similar grievances, so I do have hope that changes will be implemented.

Until then, the new launcher provides no benefits & lacks what is to me a necessary feature, so I do not intend to switch until this issue is addressed.

Thank you for this post, and thank you to the developers for putting so much effort into the game over all these years.

Today, I'm not able to do this with the new Minecraft launcher because Microsoft just decided to remove account switching. So I still use the older one, but how long it will be maintained?
Please implement this needed feature.

Help your ideas make it into Minecraft and join existing threads in progress, even if your idea isn't an exact match - we read ALL the comments. This is a necessity, horror has been the core of Minecraft since the start with zombies, skeletons, giant spiders, etc. One of the leading points in the popularity boom of Minecraft was herobrine back in the early days which was a horror story spawned from the game. Leaning into the horror is a huge step in the right direction. What better way to do it than with ghosts and other spooky additions. Love the idea of the underworld too.

An update to the launcher broke the ability to play 1.7.10 completely on Ubuntu, with and without mods.  The constant updates were annoying enough, but now the mod I play (LOTR) does not work at all.  Re installation lets it work once, then the update immediately breaks it.  I have tried starting the launcher without a network connection, but turning the network on afterward no longer works.

This is a serious problem and needs more attention. I only play old versions of the game, and I have paid for the game three times. I should have every right to just play my old versions (like 1.2.1) in peace and not have to deal with the new launcher. Launcher updates provide zero utility to me and only serve to bloat my system and waste my time, besides looking ugly. Just add an option so people can launch the game without having to update the launcher which they DONT USE for anything but starting the game. It's quite anti-consumer the way it is.

We really need this, I run MC through curse and it seems every other week I need to purge the game folder because your launcher botches a download, I bought this game to play not troubleshoot a problem brought on by your launcher.

I'm in the same boat as some of the other folks here. My child has an old hand-me-down macbook with an old version of osx -- I can't upgrade the OS without updating the computer, and I am not interested in shelling out hundreds of dollars so my kid can play a $30 game that used to run just fine on this very computer. I can download an old launcher and get minecraft to launch one time, before the launcher tries to update itself and breaks itself, throwing the error "LoadErrorABIMismatch". At the very least it would be nice if there were a flag we could set in a settings file somewhere to turn this behavior off.
people don't play minecraft anymore it's just update after update they launch and never get around to actually playing the game.
I play with a group of about 5 people on a private server.  Every time my launcher updates I can't play for a week until the server admin gets a chance to update.

Agreed! This kinda ruins the player experience on the launcher.

I agree. Personally, it kind of makes me feel there's something wrong or broken with my installation :) Also, I think, instead of moving the warning symbol, there just needs to be an option in the launcher to turn it off.

or even hide an option like that in settings, just make informed players' lifes easier
